page.title: 17Peterlee Emeralds Jazz Band.
page.content: The{Peterlee Emeralds jazz band}was formed 21 years ago in 1964. The band has 910 medals. The{uniforms}are orange,white and green and consist of jackets and trousers. The{instruments we use are kazoos,drums,tenor drums, cymbals,glockenspiel and bass drum. There are forty people in the band. The drum core have green and white uniforms. The people with the maces have orange,white and green uniforms. It is is ten pence each week for subs, which are paid every Wednesday. On Saturday it costs forty pence to go on the bus, or it is a pound if you are not in the band. The person who has got the most medals is the bass drummer. We have three different kinds of step. Our parade tunes are "When The Saints Go Marching In", "There's Oil In My Lamp" and "I Want To Go Home".
